qas.question: What was the previous name of the United Church of Christ?
What percentage of Marshall Islanders belong to the Assemblies of God?
What percentage of Marshall Islands residents are Mormons?
What percentage of Marshall Islanders worship at the Assembly of God Part Two?
When did the first mosque in Majuro open?

context: Major religious groups in the Republic of the Marshall Islands include the United Church of Christ (formerly <a0_0>Congregational<a0_0/>), with 51.5% of the population; the Assemblies of God, <a1_0>24.2%<a1_0/>; the Roman Catholic Church, 8.4%; and The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints (Mormons), <a2_0>8.3%<a2_0/>; Also represented are Bukot Nan Jesus (also known as Assembly of God Part Two), <a3_0>2.2%<a3_0/>; Baptist, 1.0%; Seventh-day Adventists, 0.9%; Full Gospel, 0.7%; and the Baha'i Faith, 0.6%; Persons without any religious affiliation account for a very small percentage of the population. There is also a small community of Ahmadiyya Muslims based in Majuro, with the first mosque opening in the capital in <a4_0>September 2012<a4_0/>.
